TextFlow.p: It is important to use speech marks (also called 'inverted commas' or 'quotation marks') correctly when you use speech or dialogue in your story.
If you are reporting the thoughts or words of a character indirectly, do not use speech marks. e.g. Would he and Ben get on well together?
If you are giving the direct words of a character, remember:
Speech marks go outside the words spoken by the speaker. The spoken words are divided from the reporting verb by a comma, and a full stop comes at the end:
